name: Carpet Shark (NES Homebrew) Fista Productions
description:
Carpet Shark. Released 1/25/2021 For the Nintendo Entertainment System. Based on the 2013 Fista Productions short film.

"A shark's soul is trapped inside an 8x10 area rug. It's General Major Cadaver Scab's duty to keep the shark tame. Can he? CAN ANYONE?"

Play as the Carpet Shark. Eat as many victims as you can before the timer and your health run out. After each level, fight one of the 4 bosses (our characters from the movie). Try to eat the bosses weapons to fire back at them. Can you beat all 4 levels?

Runners = 100 points + 1 health point
Skulls = 200 points
Dark Skulls = 300 points
Bosses = 1000 points

Depending on how high or low your points are, you will get a different win screen at the end of the game (0 - 9,999 points, 10,000 - 19,999 points, or 20,000+ points).  

There are four secret rooms. On the High Score screen:
Hold Left & Select for secret #1.
Hold Right & Select for secret #2.
Hold Up & Select for secret #3.
Hold Down & Select for secret #4.  

On the Title Screen, if you wait it’ll go into a cut scene. You can also press the select button to get to/scroll through the cut scene so you don’t have to wait.  

All original graphics and music. Matt Kennedy created the title theme and main theme for the movie. Steve McCall transcribed them to the NES the best way he could. Then Steve made more original music with help from our friend, Logana.

Poster art by Alex Gavrilas Commercial voice over by Andy Colón

Game/Graphics/Programming: Steve McCall Music: Matt Kennedy, Steve McCall, and Logana Special Thanks: Dale Coop, CutterCross, and Jonny D (All of them for helping me when I was stuck)

Also big thank you to Joe Granato, Austin McKinley and crew at NESMakers. Otherwise this project would’ve never happened.
